verses.verse: Come down <WH3381>, and sit <WH3427> in the dust <WH6083>, O virgin <WH1330> daughter <WH1323> of Babylon <WH894>, sit <WH3427> on the ground <WH776>: there is no throne <WH3678>, O daughter <WH1323> of the Chaldeans <WH3778>: for thou shalt no more <WH3254> be called <WH7121> tender <WH7390> and delicate <WH6028>.

Take <WH3947> the millstones <WH7347>, and grind <WH2912> meal <WH7058>: uncover <WH1540> thy locks <WH6777>, make bare <WH2834> the leg <WH7640>, uncover <WH1540> the thigh <WH7785>, pass over <WH5674> the rivers <WH5104>.
Thy nakedness <WH6172> shall be uncovered <WH1540>, yea, thy shame <WH2781> shall be seen <WH7200>: I will take <WH3947> vengeance <WH5359>, and I will not meet <WH6293> thee as a man <WH120>.
As for our redeemer <WH1350>, the LORD <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> is his name <WH8034>, the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel <WH3478>.

Sit <WH3427> thou silent <WH1748>, and get <WH935> thee into darkness <WH2822>, O daughter <WH1323> of the Chaldeans <WH3778>: for thou shalt no more <WH3254> be called <WH7121>, The lady <WH1404> of kingdoms <WH4467>.

I was wroth <WH7107> with my people <WH5971>, I have polluted <WH2490> mine inheritance <WH5159>, and given <WH5414> them into thine hand <WH3027>: thou didst shew <WH7760> them no mercy <WH7356>; upon the ancient <WH2205> hast thou very <WH3966> heavily <WH3513> laid thy yoke <WH5923>.

And thou saidst <WH559>, I shall be a lady <WH1404> for ever <WH5769>: so that thou didst not lay <WH7760> these things to thy heart <WH3820>, neither didst remember <WH2142> the latter end <WH319> of it.

Therefore hear <WH8085> now this, thou that art given to pleasures <WH5719>, that dwellest <WH3427> carelessly <WH983>, that sayest <WH559> in thine heart <WH3824>, I am, and none else <WH657> beside me; I shall not sit <WH3427> as a widow <WH490>, neither shall I know <WH3045> the loss of children <WH7908>:

But these two <WH8147> things shall come <WH935> to thee in a moment <WH7281> in one <WH259> day <WH3117>, the loss of children <WH7908>, and widowhood <WH489>: they shall come <WH935> upon thee in their perfection <WH8537> for the multitude <WH7230> of thy sorceries <WH3785>, and for the great <WH3966> abundance <WH6109> of thine enchantments <WH2267>.

For thou hast trusted <WH982> in thy wickedness <WH7451>: thou hast said <WH559>, None seeth <WH7200> me. Thy wisdom <WH2451> and thy knowledge <WH1847>, it hath perverted <WH7725> thee; and thou hast said <WH559> in thine heart <WH3820>, I am, and none else <WH657> beside me. perverted: or, caused thee to turn away

Therefore shall evil <WH7451> come <WH935> upon thee; thou shalt not know <WH3045> from whence it riseth <WH7837>: and mischief <WH1943> shall fall <WH5307> upon thee; thou shalt not be able <WH3201> to put it off <WH3722>: and desolation <WH7722> shall come <WH935> upon thee suddenly <WH6597>, which thou shalt not know <WH3045>. from: Heb. the morning thereof put: Heb. expiate

Stand <WH5975> now with thine enchantments <WH2267>, and with the multitude <WH7230> of thy sorceries <WH3785>, wherein <WH834> thou hast laboured <WH3021> from thy youth <WH5271>; if so be thou shalt be able <WH3201> to profit <WH3276>, if so be thou mayest prevail <WH6206>.

Thou art wearied <WH3811> in the multitude <WH7230> of thy counsels <WH6098>. Let now the astrologers <WH1895> <WH8064>, the stargazers <WH2374> <WH3556>, the monthly <WH2320> prognosticators <WH3045>, stand up <WH5975>, and save <WH3467> thee from these things that shall come <WH935> upon thee. astrologers: Heb. viewers of the heavens the monthly: Heb. that give knowledge concerning the months

Behold, they shall be as stubble <WH7179>; the fire <WH784> shall burn <WH8313> them; they shall not deliver <WH5337> themselves <WH5315> from the power <WH3027> of the flame <WH3852>: there shall not be a coal <WH1513> to warm <WH2552> at, nor fire <WH217> to sit <WH3427> before it. themselves: Heb. their souls

Thus shall they be unto thee with whom thou hast laboured <WH3021>, even thy merchants <WH5503>, from thy youth <WH5271>: they shall wander <WH8582> every one <WH376> to his quarter <WH5676>; none shall save <WH3467> thee.
